title: Kandy wake up late to demolish Police
byline: Unbeaten league champions, Kandy Sports Club produced a commanding second-half revival to overcome Police Sports Club by 49 points (9 tries, 2 conversions) to 17 points (2 tries, 2 conversions, 1 penalty) in their Inter-Club League encounter at the Nittawela Rugby Stadium, turning a nervy contest into a decisive statement of intent.

title: Schools girls’ basketball finals left in limbo amid repeated postponements
byline: Sri Lanka’s all-island schools girls’ basketball competitions have come under scrutiny as the Under-15 Girls’ A Division final for 2024 and the Under-17 Girls’ A Division final for 2025 remain unplayed, leaving young athletes waiting for closure for more than a year in some instances.

title: Safety concerns mount for females in evacuation centres after Ditwah
byline: Conditions in evacuation centres set up following Cyclone Ditwah have raised serious safety concerns, as overcrowding and the lack of privacy increase the risk of violence against vulnerable groups, particularly adolescent girls, elderly women, and women with disabilities, humanitarian agencies point out.

title: NMRA temporarily withdraws Ondansetron injections amid safety concerns
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) has temporarily withdrawn four batches of the Ondansetron injection, a critical medicine used to prevent vomiting and nausea in young children, pregnant women, and patients undergoing surgery or anesthesia, with immediate effect.

title: Ditwah forces importation of some rice varieties?
byline: The devastation caused by Cyclone Ditwah may force the Government to import some varieties of rice, Minister of Agriculture and Irrigation K. D. Lal Kantha hinted over the weekend.

title: Father hires daughter for prostitution
byline: An individual who lured his 13 year old daughter to engage in prostitution and seven individuals who raped her were arrested by Nindavur Police in Ampara. The statement of the victim revealed that she had been raped by twelve individuals and that she engaged in prostitution at the instigation of her father for more than five months.

title: Blood sample of Asoka Ranwala sent to Govt. Analyst
byline: The blood sample report of former Speaker and NPP MP Asoka Ranwala, who was involved in a road accident in Sapugaskanda last week, has been sent to the Government Analyst’s Department (GAD) for official analysis to determine whether he was under the influence of alcohol at the time of the accident, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: At least 17 dead and 20 injured after school bus crashed off cliff in Colombia
byline: At least 17 people were killed and 20 were injured after a school bus carrying children and adults crashed off a cliff in northern Colombia.

title: At least 15 killed in shooting at Jewish festival at Sydney’s Bondi Beach
byline: Two gunmen have attacked a Jewish festival at Sydney’s popular Bondi Beach, killing at least 15 people and wounding dozens, according to Australian authorities.

title: Bondi Beach shooting: At least 10 killed and several injured in park attack
byline: Police say at least 10 people have been killed in a shooting near a Jewish gathering at Sydney’s Bondi Beach.

title: Former CPC Chairman arrested on corruption charges
byline: Former Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), Dhammika Ranatunga was arrested today (15) by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in connection with an ongoing investigation.

title: No Sri Lankans injured in Sydney shooting: Foreign Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment & Tourism has confirmed that no Sri Lankan nationals were injured in the shooting incident that occurred during a Jewish festival celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach on Sunday.

title: Sri Lanka condemns Bondi Beach terror attack
byline: In the wake of the attack at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath said Sri Lanka stands in solidarity with Australia and reaffirmed its strong opposition to terrorism in all its forms.

title: SL needs ADB support for rebuilding after Cyclone Ditwah: Sajith tells ADB rep
byline: Sri Lanka needs more support from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to make a comeback after the recent disaster, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa told ADB Country Representative Takafumi Kadon.

title: Nawalapitiya–Kandy road reopened after cyclone damage
byline: The Nawalapitiya–Kandy main road, which was damaged by Cyclone Ditwa, was reopened to traffic today (15) after being closed for 18 days, the Road Development Authority (RDA) said.

title: Govt. to call for international donor conference
byline: The government is planning to convene an international donor conference to seek assistance for rebuilding the disaster-hit country, Foreign Affairs Minister Vijitha Herath told the Daily Mirror.

title: At least 17 dead and 20 injured after school bus crashed off cliff in Colombia
byline: At least 17 people were killed and 20 were injured after a school bus carrying children and adults crashed off a cliff in northern Colombia.

title: Police deploys additional officers ahead of festive season
byline: Sri Lanka Police has taken special measures ahead of the upcoming festive season, deploying additional officers and plainclothes personnel to strengthen security in major cities and at religious sites, ensuring public safety during large gatherings.

title: Why Sri Lanka should not delay in organizing a donor conference: Former diplomat Kananathan
byline: Sri Lanka should not delay in organizing an international Donor Conference in the aftermath of one of the worst natural calamities the country has experienced in its modern history—an event now widely considered to be more devastating than the 2004 tsunami. Initial assessments estimate the damage at over USD 7 billion, with the figure expected to increase as comprehensive evaluations continue.

title: Two poachers arrested with 74 kg of sambar deer meat in Wanathawilluwa
byline: Two poachers were arrested yesterday by officers of the Wanathawilluwa Wildlife Office during a routine patrol in the Wanathawilluwa area for the illegal possession of Sambar deer meat, wildlife officials said.

title: Defective brakes found in vehicle involved in accident with Asoka Ranwala
byline: A defect in the braking system has been identified in the vehicle of former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Parliamentarian Asoka Ranwala, which was involved in an accident in Sapugaskanda on Thursday (11).

title: Flights disrupted and construction work banned after Delhi air pollution suddenly worsens
byline: Construction work was halted and emergency pollution curbs reimposed across India’s capital on Monday after the air quality deteriorated sharply to some of the worst levels seen this winter, exposing millions to hazardous smog and disrupting flights.

title: Emirates airline to deliver aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka on passenger flights
byline: Emirates airline is to use passenger flights to deliver urgent aid to Sri Lanka for the next two weeks, under a partnership with Dubai Humanitarian.

title: No point in subjecting MP Asoka Ranwala to a breathalyser test now: Opposition MP
byline: There is no meaning in subjecting NPP MP Asoka Ranwala to a breathalyser test now to determine whether he was under the influence of liquor when he met with the recent accident. It is too late now for such an eventuality as one will not be able to find out whether he was drunk at the time of the accident, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harshana Rajakaruna said today.

title: No Sri Lankan in IPL Mini-Auction’s Top 5 Costliest Buys
byline: As the IPL 2026 mini-auction approaches, Sri Lankan fans will once again watch closely, hoping one of their stars will command a record-breaking bid. However, history suggests otherwise, with no Sri Lankan player ever featuring among the top five most expensive buys in an IPL mini-auction — a list dominated by Australian and English match-winners.

title: Harmer and Verma named ICC Players of the Month for November 2025
byline: South African spinner Simon Harmer went past Bangladesh’s Taijul Islam and Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Nawaz to be named the ICC Men’s Player of the Month for the first time.

title: Hollywood director Rob Reiner, wife Michele found dead in LA home
byline: US director and actor Rob Reiner and his wife have been found dead at their home in Los Angeles.

title: Over 18,000 enterprises affected by Ditwah
byline: Over 18,000 enterprises have been affected by Cyclone Ditwah, with the Industrial Disaster Support Centre (IDSC) recording 18,321 entries and inquiries as of today (15), the Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry said.

title: Disaster-related online scams on the rise: CERT
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) has urged the public to remain highly vigilant amid a sharp increase in online scams and embezzlement attempts reported across social media platforms in recent weeks.

title: Sri Lanka records 5.4% positive growth rate in 3rd quarter of 2025
byline: The Gross Domestic Product (GDP) rate for the third quarter of year 2025 has been reported as 5.4 percent of the positive growth rate, the Department of Census and Statistics (DCS) of Sri Lanka said.

title: Donations cross $1.1 million for Bondi Beach ‘hero’ Ahmed al Ahmed who disarmed shooter
byline: Donations have poured in from across Australia for a man who wrestled a gun from one of the alleged attackers during the mass shooting at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, with the total now crossing $1.1 million ($744,000), Reuters reported.

title: Sri Lanka receives 200 metric tonnes of humanitarian relief from Pakistan
byline: A consignment of humanitarian relief supplies donated by the Government of Pakistan for disaster relief in Sri Lanka was officially received today at the Colombo International Container Terminal (CICT), Colombo Port.

title: Schools in six provinces to reopen tomorrow as scheduled: Ministry Secretary
byline: All schools in the Western, Southern, Northern, Eastern, Sabaragamuwa and North-Central provinces will reopen tomorrow (16) as scheduled, Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Nalaka Kaluwewa announced today.

title: World Bank confirms US$120 million in emergency support to Sri Lanka
byline: In response to the Government’s request, the World Bank is making up to US$120 million in emergency support available by repurposing funds from ongoing projects, the World Bank said today.

title: Senura Civil Engineering, Rank Container Terminal donate Rs. 50 mn to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established to restore the lives of people affected by Cyclone Ditwah and to rebuild the country in the aftermath of the disaster, continues to receive generous contributions on a daily basis from local and international organisations, members of the business community and philanthropists, the President’s Media Division said

title: Arjuna Ranatunga to be arrested: Bribery Commission informs court
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today informed the cheif magistrate’s court that steps are being taken to arrest former Minister Arjuna Ranatunga and produce him before court, after naming him as a suspect in an incident in which an alleged loss of nearly Rs. 800 million was caused to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) by implementing spot tenders at higher prices.

title: Army troops hand over recovered cash, gold to landslide victim
byline: Sri Lanka Army troops attached to the Hanguranketha Divisional Secretariat (DS) Office for disaster relief duties handed over recovered personal belongings to a house owner whose residence was completely destroyed by a landslide.

title: School children can use November train season tickets for December: Railway Dept.
byline: The Railways Department has announced that students are allowed to use their November railway season tickets to travel on school days in December 2025.

title: Japanese medical team to fly back tonight after humanitarian mission
byline: The 31-member Japan Disaster Relief (JDR) Medical Team that engaged in providing medical-assistance to disaster affected people has concluded their mission and is scheduled to fly home toningt.

title: SLFP prunes leader’s authority, sweeping changes incorporated into party constitution
byline: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has introduced sweeping changes to its Constitution, significantly pruning the authority of the party chairman or leader, an official said.

title: Sri Lanka could face economic crisis by Sinhala New Year: Harin
byline: Sri Lanka could face an economic crisis by the Sinhala New Year 2026, fueled by Cyclone Ditwah as it has been predicted by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, United National Party (UNP) Deputy General Secretary Harin Fernando said today.

title: CTU questions Education Ministry over three-day school schedule
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) has called on the Education Ministry to clarify the rationale behind conducting government schools for only three days from December 29.

title: Galle Municipal Council budget defeated
byline: The annual budget of the Galle Municipal Council, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), was defeated by a majority vote today (15).
